intro: Halerpestes kawakamii, commonly known as the Kawakami's hawthorn, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to the island of Taiwan and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that are typically eaten by birds and other animals. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
